entries: This iron amulet is embossed with a spider emblem. While wearing this token, you can use an action to cast the {@spell disguise self} spell from it at will. The spell ends if the hat is removed.

item.name: Ward Token
entries: A creature carrying a ward token is unaffected by the {@spell antimagic field} in the Broken Goblet (see "{@adventure Roaringshore|CallfromtheDeep|7|Roaringshore|0}" in chapter 3 of {@i Call from the Deep}).

item.name: Lhammaruntosz's Wand of Fireballs
entries: This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast the {@spell fireball} spell (save DC 15) from it, dealing acid instead of fire damage. For 1 charge, you cast the 3rd-level version of the spell. You can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional charge you expend.
The wand regains {@dice 1d6 + 1} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

entries.name: Guardian
entries: The item whispers warnings to its bearer, granting a +2 bonus to initiative if the bearer isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

item.name: Dreadcutter
entries: Dreadcutter is a galleon that bristles with weaponry and flies a black pennant.

entries.name: Speed (per turn)
entries: 25 feet

entries.name: Weaponry
entries: Dreadcutter is equipped with two {@object ballista|dmg|ballistae}, a {@object mangonel}, and a {@object ram}, and can make one attack with each per turn. {@note Galleons have 5 weapon slots, so an additional weapon could be installed at the DM's discretion.}

items.name: Ballista
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 120/480 ft., one target. {@h} 16 ({@damage 3d10}) piercing damage.

items.name: Mangonel
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 200/800 ft. (can't hit targets within 60 feet of it), one target. {@h} 27 ({@damage 5d10}) bludgeoning damage.

items.name: Ram
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one object. {@h} 16 ({@damage 3d10}) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Sentience
entries: Dreadcutter is a sentient chaotic evil ship with an Intelligence of {@d20 3|16}, a Wisdom of {@d20 0|10}, and a Charisma of {@d20 4|18}. It has hearing out to a range of 120 feet.
The ship can speak and read {@language Common}, and communicate telepathically with any creature within 120 feet of it in a malicious, snarky tone.

entries.name: Personality
entries: Dreadcutter is arrogant and egotistic, desiring nothing more than to become the most feared pirate vessel on the Sword Coast. The ship was created when a drow wizard took her life aboard the galleon. Her soul lingers in the ship but retains no memory of her life.

entries.name: Attunement
entries: A character can attune to and interact with Dreadcutter as if it were a sentient weapon, though Dreadcutter attempts to take control of its wielder if it doesn't sink at least one ship per tenday.

item.name: Clawed Gauntlet
entries: A character proficient with {@item shortsword|phb|shortswords} is considered proficient with the gauntlets.

item.name: Scarlet Marpenoth
entries: The Scarlet Marpenoth has a crew of five {@creature drow elite warrior|mm|drow elite warriors}.
{@note The Scarlet Marpenoth is a submarine. Additional information can be found in {@adventure chapter 7|wdh|8|Submarine Features|0} of {@i Waterdeep: Dragon Heist}.}

item.name: The Flying Squid
entries: The Flying Squid is a sailing ship powered by a {@creature water elemental} which is bound to a gyroscopic adamantine prison in the hold. Successfully binding the elemental requires a DC 20 Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) check.

item.name: Aslaug Waveborn's Spear
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

entries.name: Waterborne
entries: This item floats on water and other liquids. Its bearer has advantage on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks to swim.

item.name: Baragsh's +3 Adamantine Glaive
entries: A {@item +3 adamantine glaive|CallfromtheDeep} whose green blade is banded and mottled in a pattern reminiscent of astral skies. It belonged to Baragsh—a male orc captain of a spacefaring vessel from the Astral Plane. A creature attuned to the weapon gains proficiency in vehicles (air), and can add their proficiency bonus to checks made to navigate in the Astral Plane.

entries.name: +3 Adamantine Glaive
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Whenever you hit an object with this weapon, the hit is a critical hit.

item.name: Captain Tharhava Shestendeliath's Scimitar of Speed
entries: A {@item scimitar of speed} that belonged to Captain Tharhava Shestendeliath—a non-binary blue dragonborn swashbuckler. A creature attuned to the weapon becomes obsessively driven by the draconian voice in their mind commanding them to avenge their death at the hands of Tharcereli. The creature cannot unattune to the weapon, and are unwillig to part with it until Tharcereli is killed. In addition, they gain the breath weapon of a blue {@race dragonborn} (see chapter 2 of the {@i Player's Handbook}).

entries.name: Scimitar of Speed
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. In addition, you can make one attack with it as a bonus action on each of your turns.

item.name: Tallyn Amberheart's Flame Tongue Longsword
entries: A {@item flame tongue longsword} which belonged to a Tallyn Amberheart—a human paladin of The Red Knight. Those who wield it hear a commanding woman's voice in their mind instructing during combat. Once per long rest, a creature attuned to the blade can use a bonus action to cause an ally within 30 feet of them that can hear them to use their reaction to make a melee weapon attack.

entries.name: Flame Tongue
entries: You can use a bonus action to speak this magic sword's command word, causing flames to erupt from the blade. These flames shed bright light in a 40-foot radius and dim light for an additional 40 feet. While the sword is ablaze, it deals an extra {@damage 2d6} fire damage to any target it hits. The flames last until you use a bonus action to speak the command word again or until you drop or sheathe the sword.

item.name: Werydd Giantsbane's Giant Slayer Greataxe
entries: A {@item giant slayer greataxe} which belonged to Werydd Giantsbane—a shield dwarf champion. A creature attuned to the weapon grows ginger braids and swells in girth. They also gain advantage on saving throws against poison, and resistance to poison damage.

entries.name: Giant Slayer
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

When you hit a giant with it, the giant takes an extra {@damage 2d6} slashing damage and must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or fall {@condition prone}. For the purpose of this weapon, "giant" refers to any {@filter creature with the giant type|bestiary|type=giant}, including ettins and trolls.

item.name: Crystal Skull
entries: The skull can be used to cast the {@spell speak with dead} spell once per day.

item.name: Black Candle
entries: A black candle with an illusory flame that extinguishes all nonmagical light sources in a room when snuffed.

item.name: Drow Slippers of Spider Climbing
entries: While you wear these light shoes, you can move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilings, while leaving your hands free. You have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed. However, the slippers don't allow you to move this way on a slippery surface, such as one covered by ice or oil.
This item loses its enchantment permanently if it is exposed to sunlight for 1 hour or longer.

item.name: Delver's Armour
entries: You have a +1 bonus to AC while wearing this armour. While wearing the armour underwater, you can speak {@homebrew its|it's} command word as an action to create a bubble of air around your head. It allows you to breathe normally underwater. This bubble stays with you until you speak the command word again, you doff the armour, or you are no longer underwater

item.name: Figurine of Wondrous Power, Aquamarine Dolphin
entries: A figurine of wondrous power is a statuette of a beast small enough to fit in a pocket. If you use an action to speak the command word and throw the figurine to a point on the ground within 60 feet of you, the figurine becomes a living creature. If the space where the creature would appear is occupied by other creatures or objects, or if there isn't enough space for the creature, the figurine doesn't become a creature.
The creature is friendly to you and your companions. It understands your languages and obeys your spoken commands. If you issue no commands, the creature defends itself but takes no other actions.

The creature exists for a duration specific to each figurine. At the end of the duration, the creature reverts to its figurine form. It reverts to a figurine early if it drops to 0 hit points or if you use an action to speak the command word again while touching it. When the creature becomes a figurine again, its property can't be used again until a certain amount of time has passed, as specified in the figurine's description.
{@creature dolphin|vgm|Aquamarine Dolphin}.
The aquamarine dolphin can become a {@creature dolphin|vgm} for up to 6 hours. While in dolphin form, the figurine allows you to cast the {@spell water breathing} spell at will.

item.name: Marid Conch
entries: This iridescent pink conch shell weighs 1 pound. When you use an action to rub the conch, a cloud of thick sea mist flows out of the shell. At the end of your turn, the mist disappears with a flash of harmless lightning, and a {@creature marid} appears in an unoccupied space within 30 feet of you.
The first time the shell is rubbed, the DM rolls to determine what happens.

rows: The {@creature marid} attacks you. After fighting for 5 rounds, the {@creature marid} disappears, and the conch loses its magic.

The {@creature marid} serves you for 1 hour, doing as you command. The marid then returns to the conch. The conch can't be activated again for 24 hours. The next two times the conch is used, the same effect occurs. If the conch is opened a fourth time, the {@creature marid} escapes and disappears, and the conch loses its magic.
The {@creature marid} can cast the {@spell wish} spell three times for you. It disappears when it grants the wish or after 1 hour, and the conch loses its magic.

item.name: Psionic Suit
entries: This item appears to be a Large suit of {@item plate armor|phb|plate armour} weighing 250 lbs. The suit has a hatch at the rear, through which one creature can enter using an action. That creature becomes the pilot.
The psionic suit is a Large object with the following statistics:

items.name: Speed:
items.entry: fly 3 × the pilot's Intelligence score

items.name: Damage Immunities:
items.entry: poison, psychic

entries: Once inside the pilot can operate the suit through thought. The suit has two {@action Attack} options, both of which require an action:

items: Make two gauntlet attacks, with a bonus to the attack roll equal to the pilot's Intelligence score, dealing 11 ({@damage 2d10}) plus the pilot's Intelligence score bludgeoning damage on a hit. The suit can forego the damage to grapple a target (escape DC equals 10 plus the creature's Intelligence score).

Attempt to explode a creature's brain. One creature the pilot can see within 60 feet of it must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw. The DC equals 10 + the pilot's Intelligence modifier. The target takes 27 ({@damage 5d10}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful save.

entries: Any ability check or saving throw made by the suit has a bonus equal to the pilot's Intelligence score, plus their proficiency bonus if applicable.
A pilot with spellcasting (psionics) adds their proficiency to any {@dice d20} roll made by the suit, and can cast their spells through the suit.

entries.by: script stolen by 'Fast Hands' Harrigan from an outpost on the Astral Plane

item.name: Staff of the Eel
item.reqAttune: by a cleric, druid, or warlock
entries: You can use an action to speak this staff's command word and throw the staff on the ground within 10 feet of you. The staff becomes a {@creature giant lightning eel|tftyp} under your control and acts on its own initiative count. By using a bonus action to speak the command word again, you return the staff to its normal form in a space formerly occupied by the eel.

On your turn, you can mentally command the eel if it is within 60 feet of you and you aren't incapacitated. You decide what action the eel takes and where it moves during its next turn, or you can issue it a general command, such as to attack your enemies or guard a location.

If the eel is reduced to 0 hit points, it dies and reverts to its staff form. The staff then shatters and is destroyed. If the eel reverts to staff form before losing all its hit points, it regains all of them.

item.name: Tome of the Deep
entries: You have resistance to cold damage while attuned to this tome, you can breathe underwater, and you have a swimming speed of 30 feet.

The tome has 10 charges, While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC: {@spell control water} (4 charges), {@spell create or destroy water} (1 charge), {@spell maelstrom|xge} (5 charges), {@spell tidal wave|xge} (3 charges), {@spell wall of water|xge} (3 charges), {@spell water breathing} (3 charges), {@spell water walk} (3 charges), {@spell watery sphere|xge} (4 charges), {@spell tsunami} (8 charges).
The tome regains {@dice 1d6 + 4} charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the tome turns to water, pours through your fingers, and is destroyed

item.name: Wand of Diminution
entries: This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast the reduce effect of the {@spell enlarge/reduce} spell (DC 15) from it.
The wand regains {@dice 1d6 + 1} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

item.name: Wand of Stone Shape
entries: This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend one of its charges to cast the {@spell stone shape} spell from it.
The wand regains {@dice 1d6 + 1} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

item.name: Mind Carapace Breastplate
entries: Any nonmagical suit of heavy armour can be turned by mind flayers into mind carapace armour. Only one creature can attune to it: either a specific mind flayer or one of its thralls. While worn by any other creature, the mind carapace armour functions as normal armour of its kind. To its intended wearer, the armour grants advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws and makes its wearer immune to the {@condition frightened} condition.

item.name: Crest
entries: This {@item +1 dagger} belongs to {@creature Ramazith Flamesinger|CallfromtheDeep}, and has the following additional magic properties:

items: As a bonus action, you can cause a green stone set into the dagger's pommel to shed bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet, or make the stone go dark.
Whenever you starts your turn underwater with 0 hit points, the dagger causes you to rise 60 feet toward the surface.

trait.name: Lightfooted
entries: The swashbuckler can take the {@action Dash} or {@action Disengage} action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: Suave Defense
entries: While the swashbuckler is wearing light or no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Charisma modifier.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The swashbuckler makes three attacks: one with a dagger and two with its rapier.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, Hrug can move up to his movement speed toward a hostile creature he can see or hear. He must end this move closer to the enemy than he started.

trait.name: Powerful Build
entries: Hrug counts as one size larger when determining his carrying capacity and the weight he can push, drag, or lift.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The veteran makes two longsword attacks. If it has a shortsword drawn, it can also make a shortsword attack.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d10 + 1}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The priest's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Shared Spellcasting
headerEntries: If encountered together, the Elders can each cast the following spells from the warlock's spell list but must share the spell slots among themselves:
footerEntries: For casting these spells, each kraken priest is a 12th-level spellcaster that uses Wisdom as its spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks).

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The priest can breathe air and water.

action.name: Thunderous Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}27 ({@damage 5d10}) thunder damage.

action.name: Voice of the Kraken (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: A kraken speaks through the priest with a thunderous voice audible within 300 feet. Creatures of the priest's choice that can hear the kraken's words (which are spoken in {@language Abyssal}, {@language Infernal}, or {@language Primordial}) must succeed on a {@dc 14} Charisma saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The warlock's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma. It can innately cast the following spells (spell save {@dc 15}), requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The warlock is a 14th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). It regains its expended spell slots when it finishes a short or long rest. It knows the following warlock spells:

spellcasting.name: Staff of the Magi: Spells
headerEntries: While holding the staff, Ingrimarr can use an action to expend some of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using their spell save DC ({@dc 15}) and spellcasting ability (Charisma): {@spell conjure elemental} (7 charges), {@spell dispel magic} (3 charges), {@spell fireball} (7th-level version, 7 charges), {@spell flaming sphere} (2 charges), {@spell ice storm} (4 charges), {@spell invisibility} (2 charges), {@spell knock} (2 charges), {@spell lightning bolt} (7th-level version, 7 charges), {@spell passwall} (5 charges), {@spell plane shift} (7 charges), {@spell telekinesis} (5 charges), {@spell wall of fire} (4 charges), or {@spell web} (2 charges).

You can also use an action to cast one of the following spells from the staff without using any charges: {@spell arcane lock}, {@spell detect magic}, {@spell enlarge/reduce}, {@spell light}, {@spell mage hand}, or {@spell protection from evil and good}.

spellcasting.name: Shared Spellcasting
headerEntries: If encountered together, the Elders can each cast the following spells from the warlock's spell list but must share the spell slots among themselves:
footerEntries: For casting these spells, Ingrimarr is a 12th-level spellcaster that uses Wisdom as its spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks).

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Ingrimarr wields {@creature Hoch Miraz|CallfromtheDeep|Hoch Miraz's} {@item staff of the magi} (included in their statistics).

trait.name: Staff of the Magi: Spell Absorption
entries: While holding the staff, Ingrimarr has advantage on saving throws against spells.

trait.name: Whispering Aura
entries: At the start of each of the warlock's turns, each creature of its choice within 5 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage, provided that the warlock isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Staff of the Magi
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage, or 5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

reaction.name: Staff of the Magi: Spell Absorption
entries: Ingrimarr can use their reaction when another creature casts a spell that targets only Ingrimarr. If they do, the staff absorbs the magic of the spell, canceling its effect and gaining a number of charges equal to the absorbed spell's level. However, if doing so brings the staff's total number of charges above 50, the staff explodes as if Ingrimarr activated its retributive strike (see {@item staff of the magi|dmg|the item}).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The captain makes three melee attacks: two with its scimitar and one with its dagger. Or the captain makes two ranged attacks with its daggers.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The captain adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the captain must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

reaction.name: Breath Weapon (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: Azzakh exhales destructive energy in a 15-foot line. Each creature in the area of the exhalation must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 2d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Lightfooted
entries: The swashbuckler can take the {@action Dash} or {@action Disengage} action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: Suave Defense
entries: While the swashbuckler is wearing light or no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Charisma modifier.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The swashbuckler makes three attacks: one with a dagger and two with its rapier.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Breath Weapon (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: Perra exhales destructive energy in a 5-by-30-foot line. Each creature in the area of the exhalation must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 3d6} acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The mage is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). The mage has the following wizard spells prepared:

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Breath Weapon (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: Darva exhales destructive energy in a 5-by-30-foot line. Each creature in the area of the exhalation must make a {@dc 10} Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 2d6} acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Lightfooted
entries: The swashbuckler can take the {@action Dash} or {@action Disengage} action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: Suave Defense
entries: While the swashbuckler is wearing light or no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Charisma modifier.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The swashbuckler makes three attacks: one with a dagger and two with its rapier.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Breath Weapon (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: Farihaan exhales destructive energy in a 5-by-30-foot line. Each creature in the area of the exhalation must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 3d6} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The veteran makes two longsword attacks. If it has a shortsword drawn, it can also make a shortsword attack.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d10 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Breath Weapon (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: Tarhun exhales destructive energy in a 5-by-30-foot line. Each creature in the area of the exhalation must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 2d6} acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Lightfooted
entries: The swashbuckler can take the {@action Dash} or {@action Disengage} action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: Suave Defense
entries: While the swashbuckler is wearing light or no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Charisma modifier.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The swashbuckler makes three attacks: one with a dagger and two with its rapier.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Breath Weapon (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: Mishann exhales destructive energy in a 5-by-30-foot line. Each creature in the area of the exhalation must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 3d6} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The elder brain's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 18}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Creature Sense
entries: The elder brain is aware of the presence of creatures within 5 miles of it that have an Intelligence score of 4 or higher. It knows the distance and direction to each creature, as well as each one's intelligence score, but can't sense anything else about it. A creature protected by a {@spell mind blank} spell, a {@spell nondetection} spell, or similar magic can't be perceived in this manner.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the elder brain fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The elder brain has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Telepathic Hub
entries: The elder brain can use its telepathy to initiate and maintain telepathic conversations with up to ten creatures at a time. The elder brain can let those creatures telepathically hear each other while connected in this way.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 4d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}) and takes 9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) psychic damage at the start of each of its turns until the grapple ends. The elder brain can have up to four targets {@condition grappled} at a time.

action.name: Mind Blast {@recharge 5}
entries: The elder brain magically emits psychic energy. Creatures of the elder brain's choice within 60 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Intelligence saving throw or take 32 ({@damage 5d10 + 5}) psychic damage and be {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Psychic Link
entries: The elder brain targets one {@condition incapacitated} creature it can perceive with its Creature Sense trait and establishes a psychic link with that creature. Until the psychic link ends, the elder brain can perceive everything the target senses. The target becomes aware that something is linked to its mind once it is no longer {@condition incapacitated}, and the elder brain can terminate the link at any time (no action required). The target can use an action on its turn to attempt to break the psychic link, doing so with a successful {@dc 18} Charisma saving throw. On a successful save, the target takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage. The psychic link also ends if the target and the elder brain are more than 5 miles apart, with no consequences to the target. The elder brain can form psychic links with up to ten creatures at a time.

action.name: Sense Thoughts
entries: The elder brain targets a creature with which it has a psychic link. The elder brain gains insight into the target's reasoning, its emotional state, and thoughts that loom large in its mind (including things the target worries about, loves, or hates). The elder brain can also make a Charisma (Deception) check with advantage to deceive the target's mind into thinking it believes one idea or feels a particular emotion. The target contests this attempt with a Wisdom (Insight) check. If the elder brain succeeds, the mind believes the deception for 1 hour or until evidence of the lie is presented to the target.

legendary.name: Tentacle
entries: The elder brain makes a tentacle attack.

legendary.name: Break Concentration
entries: The elder brain targets a creature within 120 feet of it with which it has a psychic link. The elder brain breaks the creature's concentration on a spell it has cast. The creature also takes {@dice 1d4} psychic damage per level of the spell.

legendary.name: Psychic Pulse
entries: The elder brain targets a creature within 120 feet of it with which it has a psychic link. Enemies of the elder brain within 10 feet of that creature take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage.

legendary.name: Sever Psychic Link
entries: The elder brain targets a creature within 120 feet of it with which it has a psychic link. The elder brain ends the link, causing the creature to have disadvantage on all ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws until the end of the creature's next turn.

Mit seinem unvorstellbaren Intellekt und seinem eisernen Willen ist Zellix'Phor ein Elder Brain, wie man es auf der materiellen Dimension seit Jahrhunderten nicht mehr gesehen hat, wenn überhaupt. Zellix'Phor ist entschlossen, das illithidische Imperium um sich und seine Kolonie herum wieder aufzubauen und auch die verbleibenden Gith auszurotten. Das ältere Gehirn ist arrogant und hält sich selbst für unbesiegbar, unfähig, überlistet oder übertrumpft zu werden.

Nach dem Absturz spürte Zellix'Phor zum ersten Mal Angst. Die Gith hatten ihre Kolonie bis auf eine Handvoll unbedeutender Jünger und ihre Dienerschaft zerstört. Zum Glück setzten Zellix'Phors treue Akolythen ihr Leben aufs Spiel, um ein geeignetes Schiff für sie zu finden: den Kopf von Slarkrethel, dem Kraken.

Der andauernde psionische Kampf zwischen dem älteren Gehirn und dem Kraken hat Zellix'Phors Herrschsucht wieder aufleben lassen, und das ältere Gehirn hat seine Agenten in die Schwertküste ausgesandt, um die Gehirne ihrer Bewohner und das darin enthaltene köstliche Wissen zurückzuholen.

Als mächtiger Zauberer und Aspekt von {@deity Umberlee|Faerûnian|scag} hatte Slarkrethel eine große Anhängerschaft an der Schwertküste und in den Inselkönigreichen, sowohl in der Krakengesellschaft als auch bei informellen Anhängern wie denen auf den Purpurfelsen. Jetzt, da Zellix'Phor die Kontrolle über die Kraken hat, ist das ältere Gehirn in der Lage, diese Agenten telepathisch und psionisch nach seinem Willen zu manipulieren und den Großen Plan zu fördern.

entries.name: Ideal
entries: Alle Wesen sollten sich dem Willen von Zellix'Phor unterwerfen. Ich werde meinen Einfluss über diese neue Welt ausbreiten.'

entries.name: Bond
entries: Nichts ist wichtiger als der Wiederaufbau unseres verlorenen Reiches, außer vielleicht die Ausrottung der Gith.

entries.name: Flaw
entries: Zellix'Phor ist unbesiegbar. Zellix'Phor ist unbezwingbar. Zellix'Phor ist omnipotent.'

entries.name: The Colony of Zellix'Phor
entries: Zellix'Phor ist ein uraltes älteres Gehirn, das sich an die Zerstörung des Illithidenreichs erinnert. Durch die Absorption toter illithidischer Gehirne erfuhr Zellix'Phor die Ursachen für den Untergang des Imperiums und ist besessen von Rachegelüsten. Von Blutrausch getrieben, sucht die Illithidenkolonie, die Zellix'Phor folgt, in den Dimensionen des Daseins nach Githyanki-Krippen, in der Hoffnung, deren Bevölkerung durch Kindermord zu dezimieren.

Zellix'Phor war zu einem Namen geworden, der die Gedankenschinder begeisterte und die Herzen der Gith in Angst und Schrecken versetzte. Seine verheerende Wirkung auf die githyankische Bevölkerung war allgemein bekannt, und in dieser Kultur erzählte man sich schreckliche Geschichten von der stillen und tödlichen Ankunft des illithidischen Schiffes, in dem Zellix'Phor und seine Jünger untergebracht waren.

Im Laufe der Zeit wuchs die Kolonie Zellix'Phor bis zu einem Punkt, an dem sie sich kaum noch selbst erhalten konnte. Der gesamte verfügbare nautiloide Raum wurde den Illithiden gewidmet, und ihre Sklaven wurden abgeworfen, um Platz für die überlegene Rasse zu schaffen. Der Bedarf an Gehirnen als Treibstoff für die Bewusstseinswandler führte dazu, dass der Nautiloid, in dem die Kolonie lebte, immer häufiger die Materielle Dimension besuchte. Trotz Generationen von Wissen über taktische Kriegsführung, das der Zellix'Phor assimiliert hatte, wurde ihm seine Arroganz zum Verhängnis. Der Gith hatte den Nautiloiden quer durch die Dimensionen verfolgt und auf den richtigen Zeitpunkt für einen Angriff gewartet. Im Glauben, unbesiegbar zu sein, befahl Zellix'Phor dem Schiff, an der Materiellen Ebene anzudocken, um sich mit Hirn zu versorgen, und das Schiff wurde angegriffen.

Die Githyanki-Ritter, die stärksten und furchterregendsten Krieger der kriegerischen Rasse, schlugen mit unermesslicher Kraft auf den Nautiloiden ein. Sie betraten das Schiff als Meuchelmörder und dezimierten die Illithiden im Inneren. Ohne ihre Sklaven, die die Hauptlast des Angriffs tragen mussten, standen die Gedankenflayer an vorderster Front, und trotz ihrer gewaltigen psionischen Fähigkeiten wurden viele von den Silberschwertern der Githyanki niedergestreckt. Der Nautiloid legte eine Bruchlandung auf der Nordländer-Insel Gundarlun hin und tötete fast alle an Bord. Unglücklicherweise konnten Zellix'Phor und seine engsten Begleiter überleben, geschützt vor der Zerstörung in der älteren Gehirnkammer des Nautiloiden. Aus Sicht der Githyanki war die Selbstmordmission ein Erfolg.

trait.name: Brave
entries: The gladiator has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the gladiator hits with it (included in the attack).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The gladiator makes three melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. and range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage, or 13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Shield Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The gladiator adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the gladiator must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The merrenoloth's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 13}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The merrenoloth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The merrenoloth's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Teleport
entries: As a bonus action, the merrenoloth magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The merrenoloth uses Fear Gaze once and makes one oar attack.

action.name: Oar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Fear Gaze
entries: The merrenoloth targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. The {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Despite the enormous sail atop Tentrix's lair, the construction of the vessel renders it almost immobile. Thankfully, Tentrix bought the loyalty of Kharon, a {@creature merrenoloth|mtf} capable of captaining any ship. The ship counts as the merrenoloth's lair, and they can use their lair actions and regional effects here. Kharon enjoys life aboard the ship. They're paid well, and the riotous lifestyle of the humans aboard amuses them. Despite their loyalty to the ship, Kharon's contract specifies that they are under no obligation to fight in the ship's defence.

trait.name: Nimble Escape
entries: The goblin can take the {@action Disengage} or {@action Hide} action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Grabbit wears a {@item helm of comprehending languages} that looks like a towering crown of twisted driftwood, allowing her to communicate with the crew.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The goblin makes two attacks with its whip.

action.name: Whip
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Redirect Attack
entries: When a creature the goblin can see targets it with an attack, the goblin chooses another goblin within 5 feet of it. The two goblins swap places, and the chosen goblin becomes the target instead.
{@homebrew At the DM's discretion, this reaction can also be used to swap places with any of Grabbit's crew within 5 feet.}

Despite her stature, Grabbit holds great sway on the ship. Most of the crew aboard are monstrous and respond better to her orders than those from the pirate lords or Tentrix himself. Her command over the crew comes from her ruthlessness; she has a deadly habit of kicking crew who question her authority off the plank (see {@adventure area t1|CallfromtheDeep|T1. Top Deck|0}) down to the zombie tank ({@adventure area t12|CallfromtheDeep|T12. Hold|0}) where they're torn apart by the undead ogre within.
Grabbit uses the statistics of a {@creature goblin boss} with the following changes:

items: Grabbit wears a {@item helm of comprehending languages} that looks like a towering crown of twisted driftwood, allowing her to communicate with the crew.
She wields a {@item whip|phb} instead of a {@item scimitar|phb}, and can multiattack without disadvantage.

trait.name: Lightfooted
entries: The swashbuckler can take the Dash or Disengage action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: Suave Defense
entries: While the swashbuckler is wearing light or no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Charisma modifier.

trait.name: Gnome Cunning
entries: Powder has advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Powder wears {@item eyes of minute seeing} and carries a packet of {@item smokepowder|wdh} ({@adventure appendix C|CallfromtheDeep|13}).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Powder makes three attacks: one with her dagger and two with her musket.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Musket
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 40/120 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) piercing damage.

The quartermaster of the lair is a young gnomish woman nicknamed Powder. Powder has bright orange hair that stands straight up atop her head like the flame of a candle. She is perpetually covered with soot and sawdust. She wears a pair of eyes of minute seeing and a thick leather robe puckered with burn holes, and is rarely seen without a pipe in her mouth.
Powder uses the statistics of a {@creature swashbuckler|vgm} with the following changes:

items: Powder's size is Small.
Her alignment is chaotic neutral.
Her speed is 25 feet.
She has {@sense darkvision} out to 60 feet.
She has advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.
She can speak {@language Common} and {@language Gnomish}.
She wields a {@item musket} instead of a {@item rapier|phb} ({@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, 40/120 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) piercing damage.).
She wears {@item eyes of minute seeing} and carries a packet of {@item smokepowder|wdh} ({@adventure appendix C|CallfromtheDeep|13}).

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The naga is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks), and it needs only verbal components to cast its spells. It has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If it dies, the naga returns to life in {@dice 1d6} days and regains all its hit points. Only a {@spell wish} spell can prevent this trait from functioning.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw, taking 31 ({@damage 7d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

After being ousted from her Chultan lair by {@creature Ras Nsi|toa}, Desecratus Profanis managed to take control of a ship merchant ship leaving Chult. Discovering she had a taste for piracy, she began raiding other vessels on their way to and from peninsula, amassing a hoard of wealth and magic items. Seeking greater influence over the seas, Desecratus travelled north to the Sword Coast where she made a habit of sinking Lord's Alliance vessels, which brought her to the attention of Tentrix. Although the pair initially tried to destroy each other, Desecratus saw something in Tentrix when he commanded the ocean, revealing his connection to Slarkrethel. Seeing potential for her own arcane gains, Desecratus has allied with the Sea King and serves as a pirate lord under his command, hoping one day to unlock the powers he has been afforded by the kraken.

Desecratus Profanis is a schemer. She chafes under Tentrix's command, but realises the Black Armada comes with protection and power she could not otherwise enjoy. She assists Tentrix for now, but takes note whenever the kraken priest communes with Slarkrethel and will strike when the time is right. She is willing to make deals with characters to bring down Tentrix, provided she is replaced as commander of the Black Armada. Her ability to reform after death ensures this, even if she is betrayed.

Desecratus is a fourteen foot long, purple serpent with a woman's face and blood-red markings on her hood. She talks slowly and carefully with a lisping rattle. She wears an eyepatch, covering the eye she lost in a fight with {@creature Ras Nsi|toa}.

entries.name: Ideal
entries: "I must amass enough power to returl to Chult and destroy Ras Nsi."

entries.name: Bond
entries: "My only loyalty is to myself. If Tentrix shows a sign of weakness, I'll strike."

entries.name: Flaw
entries: "I'm extremely proud and believe I deserve the utmost respect. A slight against me will not be forgotten."

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The slaad's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}). The slaad can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The slaad can use its action to polymorph into a Small or Medium humanoid, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The slaad has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The slaad regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The slaad makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws or staff. Alternatively, it uses its Hurl Flame twice.

action.name: Bite (Slaad Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw (Slaad Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Staff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Hurl Flame
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 4} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage. The fire ignites flammable objects that aren't being worn or carried.

footer.name: Control Gem
entries: The slaad must obey whoever possesses the gem and is immune to being {@condition charmed} while so controlled.
A {@spell greater restoration} spell cast on the slaad destroys the gem without harming the slaad.

Most slaadi are agents of pure chaos that hail from the Plane of Limbo. When slaadi travel to the Material Plane, they create carnage by transforming humanoids into more of their kind. Years ago, Tentrix's vessel came across a town under attack. The pirate flew into a rage after realising his raid could no longer occur, so kidnapped a slaadi in order to ransom them back. When his first mate was killed before the message could be delivered, Tentrix realised the foolishness of his plan. He then tried to kill the slaad, but his blade hit the control gem embedded in its head which he removed, gaining control over the chaotic creature.

Thenceforth the slaad has obeyed Tentrix, who found he could teach it many things, including how to captain a ship. Eventually, the slaad became a notorious pirate in its own right, adopting the identity of Captain Scummer. Tentrix elevated the creature to pirate lord after Scummer sunk a Flaming Fist vessel chasing his own. Scummer would rather not be controlled by Tentrix but has no ambition to retrieve the control gem himself. If the characters retrieve the gem, the slaad accepts their control.

Captain Scummer looks like a bloated, bipedal, green toad with a gaping maw and heavy brow. Scummer's identity as pirate captain is reflected in its choice of attire; a bright red frock coat. Scummer wields an oar, adorned with fish skulls, as its staff. Although Scummer can shapeshift into humanoid form, it does so only to avoid certain death or when commanded to do so by Tentrix.

entries.name: Ideal
entries: "Spreading chaos can be achieved through my new life as a pirate captain."

entries.name: Bond
entries: "I am controlled by Sea King Tentrix, who has possession of the gem which is bound to my soul."

entries.name: Flaw
entries: "Despite my new identity, I have a tendency to revert back to my chaotic nature."

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Jhamis' innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}). Jhamis can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Brave
entries: The gladiator has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the gladiator hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: Jhimas can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Emissary of the Sea
entries: Jhimas can communicate simple ideas with beasts that can breathe water. They can understand the meaning of his words, though he has no special ability to understand them in return.

trait.name: Guardian of the Depths
entries: Jhamis is acclimated to an underwater environment.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The gladiator makes three melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

action.name: Trident
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. and range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage, or 13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Shield Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The gladiator adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the gladiator must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Brave
entries: The knight has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Dwarven Resilience
entries: The stonewarden has advantage on saving throws against poison.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The knight makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Morningstar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7  ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 2} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d10}) piercing damage.

action.name: Leadership (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: For 1 minute, the knight can utter a special command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a {@dice d4} to its roll provided it can hear and understand the knight. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the knight is {@condition incapacitated}.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The knight adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the knight must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The necromancer is a 12th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). The necromancer has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Grim Harvest (1/Turn)
entries: When necromancer kills a creature that is neither a construct nor undead with a spell of 1st level or higher, the necromancer regains hit points equal to twice the spell's level, or three times if it is a necromancy spell.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Tulkhan wears a {@item cloak of protection} (included in his statistics).

action.name: Withering Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 2d4}) necrotic damage.

Tulkhan is a Red Wizard of Thay who fled to the Nelanthers after the thayan operations in Daggerford failed. Since arriving, he has hired pirate crews to kidnap babies from the mainland, which he used in a dark ritual to reanimate the dragon turtle known as the Curse of Irphong. After a few Black Armada vessels were sunk in Asavir's Channel by the beast, Sea King Tentrix contacted Tulkhan and asked whether he'd work for the Black Armada by getting the dragon turtle to sink Lords' Alliance warships and merchant vessels passing through the Nelanthers. In return, Tentrix ensures that word doesn't reach Daggerford about the Red Wizard's location.

monster.name: Tulkhan's Flesh Golem

immune.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Berserk
entries: Whenever the golem starts its turn with 40 hit points or fewer, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 6, the golem goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the golem attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the golem attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. Once the golem goes berserk, it continues to do so until it is destroyed or regains all its hit points.

The golem's creator, if within 60 feet of the berserk golem, can try to calm it by speaking firmly and persuasively. The golem must be able to hear its creator, who must take an action to make a {@dc 15} Charisma (Persuasion) check. If the check succeeds, the golem ceases being berserk. If it takes damage while still at 40 hit points or fewer, the golem might go berserk again.

trait.name: Aversion of Fire
entries: If the golem takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Lightning Absorption
entries: Whenever the golem is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the lightning damage dealt.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The golem makes two slam attacks or five fist attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 {@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The drow's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The drow has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the drow to sleep.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the drow has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Cunning Action
entries: On each of its turns, the drow can use a bonus actoin to take the {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, or {@action Hide} actions.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The drow deals an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage when it htis a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the drow that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the drow doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: The drow wears a {@item token of disguise|CallfromtheDeep}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The drow makes two shortsword attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Hand Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also {@condition unconscious} while {@condition poisoned} in this way. The target wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The drow adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the drow must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The warlock's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma. It can innately cast the following spells (spell save {@dc 15}), requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The warlock is a 14th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). It regains its expended spell slots when it finishes a short or long rest. It knows the following warlock spells:

trait.name: Whispering Aura
entries: At the start of each of the warlock's turns, each creature of its choice within 5 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage, provided that the warlock isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: Tempest can breathe air and water

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Tempest wields a {@item +2 rod of the pact keeper} (included in his statistics).

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: +2 Rod of the Pact Keeper (1/Day)
entries: Tempest regains one warlock spell slot.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The merfolk has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the merfolk's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The merfolk can breathe air and water.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage, or 5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

Vor der Küste liegt eine Ansammlung winziger Inselchen, die unter dem Namen Red Rocks bekannt sind. Die meisten dieser Landformen sind von den Wellen des Schwertmeeres geschliffene Felsen, aber einige sind kaum mehr als Felsbrocken, die aus den Wellen herausragen. Red Rocks hat im Laufe der Jahrhunderte zahllose Schiffe versenkt, weshalb Segler einen großen Bogen um sie machen. Fischer mit kleineren Schiffen suchen diese Gewässer jedoch häufig auf, da das Gebiet die Heimat vieler Muscheln ist, von denen einige in Waterdeep sehr geschätzt werden.

The merfolk here are more aggressive than other communities of their kind and collect tolls from ships that pass by. The reason for the aggressive nature of the merfolk has been speculated about by sailors for perhaps hundreds of years, but few know the truth. Red Rocks was once a kraken hatchery, where the monolithic beasts stored their eggs. The local merfolk were corrupted by the evil influence of the leviathans and were forced to serve as guards and caretakers for the newly born krakens. Although no eggs have been left here for centuries, the merfolk still pledge allegiance to the krakens, specifically to Slarkrethel.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While the adept is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

trait.name: Brave
entries: Jasper has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Halfling Nimbleness
entries: Jasper can move through the space of any creature that is of a size larger than his.

trait.name: Lucky
entries: When Jasper rolls a 1 on an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, he can reroll the die and must use the new roll.

trait.name: Naturally Stealthy
entries: Jasper can attempt to {@action hide} even when he is only obscured by a creature that is at least one size larger than him.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Jasper wields a {@item staff of thunder and lightning}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The adept makes three unarmed strikes or three dart attacks. Alternatively, Jasper can make two staff attacks.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, the adept can choose one of the following additional effects:

items: The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or drop one item it is holding (adept's choice).
The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.
The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of the adept's next turn.

action.name: Dart
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Staff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage, or 6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

reaction.name: Deflect Missile
entries: In response to being hit by a ranged weapon attack, the adept deflects the missile. The damage it takes from the attack is reduced by {@dice 1d10 + 3}. If the damage is reduced to 0, the adept catches the missile if it's small enough to hold in one hand and the adept has a hand free.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Lhammaruntosz is a 12th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 21}, {@hit 11} to hit with spell attacks). She has the following sorcerer spells prepared:

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The dragon can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: Lhammaruntosz erhält zu Beginn seines Zuges 20 Trefferpunkte zurück. Lhammaruntosz stirbt nur, wenn sie ihren Zug mit 0 Trefferpunkten beginnt und sich nicht regeneriert. Diese Eigenschaft funktioniert nicht in einem {@spell antimagic field}.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Lhammaruntosz carries an altered {@item Lhammaruntosz's wand of fireballs|CallfromtheDeep|wand of fireballs} that deals acid instead of fire damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 2d10 + 9}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d6 + 9}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d8 + 9}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Breath Weapons {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragon uses one of the following breath weapons.

items.name: Lightning Breath.
items.entry: The dragon exhales lightning in a 120-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 23} Dexterity saving throw, taking 88 ({@damage 16d10}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Repulsion Breath.
items.entry: The dragon exhales repulsion energy in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 23} Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is pushed 60 feet away from the dragon.

action.name: Change Shape
entries: The dragon magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating no higher than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the dragon's choice).

In a new form, the dragon retains its alignment, hit points, Hit Dice, ability to speak, proficiencies, Legendary Resistance, lair actions, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as this action. Its statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The dragon makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: The dragon makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The dragon beats its wings. Each creature within 15 feet of the dragon must succeed on a {@dc 24} Dexterity saving throw or take 16 ({@damage 2d6 + 9}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. The dragon can then fly up to half its flying speed.

monster.name: Mei Ling
languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: If the vampire isn't in sunlight or running water, it can use its action to polymorph into a Tiny quipper or a Medium cloud of mist, or back into its true form.

While in quipper form, the vampire can't speak, its walking speed is 0 feet, and it has a swimming speed of 30 feet. Its statistics, other than its size and speed, are unchanged. Anything it is wearing transforms with it, but nothing it is carrying does. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

While in mist form, the vampire can't take any actions, speak, or manipulate objects. It is weightless, has a flying speed of 20 feet, can hover, and can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. In addition, if air can pass through a space, the mist can do so without squeezing, and it can't pass through water. It has advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws, and it is immune to all nonmagical damage, except the damage it takes from sunlight.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the vampire fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Misty Escape
entries: When it drops to 0 hit points outside its resting place, the vampire transforms into a cloud of mist (as in the Shapechanger trait) instead of falling {@condition unconscious}, provided that it isn't in sunlight or running water. If it can't transform, it is destroyed.

While it has 0 hit points in mist form, it can't revert to its vampire form, and it must reach its resting place within 2 hours or be destroyed. Once in its resting place, it reverts to its vampire form. It is then {@condition paralyzed} until it regains at least 1 hit point. After spending 1 hour in its resting place with 0 hit points, it regains 1 hit point.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The vampire regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point and isn't in sunlight or running water. If the vampire takes radiant damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn't function at the start of the vampire's next turn.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The vampire can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Vampire Weaknesses
entries: The vampire has the following flaws:
{@i Forbiddance.} The vampire can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants.
{@i Harmed by Running Water.} The vampire takes 20 acid damage if it ends its turn in running water.

{@i Stake to the Heart.} If a piercing weapon made of wood is driven into the vampire's heart while the vampire is {@condition incapacitated} in its resting place, the vampire is {@condition paralyzed} until the stake is removed.
{@i Sunlight Hypersensitivity.} The vampire takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

trait.name: Underwater Domain
entries: Die natürlichen Strömungen des Ozeans gelten für keine der Funktionen von Mei Ling als "fließendes Wasser".

action.name: Multiattack (Vampire Form Only)
entries: The vampire makes two attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack.

action.name: Vicious Greatsword (Vampire Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage. When Mei Ling rolls a 20 with this magic weapon, the target takes an extra {@footnote 7 slashing damage|According to the SRD, it is an extra {@damage 2d6} slashing damage.}.

action.name: Unarmed Strike (Vampire Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. Instead of dealing damage, the vampire can grapple the target (escape {@dc 18}).

action.name: Bite (Bat or Vampire Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one willing creature, or a creature that is {@condition grappled} by the vampire, {@condition incapacitated}, or {@condition restrained}. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0. A humanoid slain in this way and then buried in the ground rises the following night as a {@creature vampire spawn} under the vampire's control.

action.name: Charm
entries: The vampire targets one humanoid it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the vampire, the target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw against this magic or be {@condition charmed} by the vampire. The {@condition charmed} target regards the vampire as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected. Although the target isn't under the vampire's control, it takes the vampire's requests or actions in the most favorable way it can, and it is a willing target for the vampire's bite attack.

Each time the vampire or the vampire's companions do anything harmful to the target, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. Otherwise, the effect lasts 24 hours or until the vampire is destroyed, is on a different plane of existence than the target, or takes a bonus action to end the effect.

action.name: Children of the Night (1/Day)
entries: The vampire magically calls {@dice 2d4} swarms of {@creature swarm of bats||bats} or {@creature swarm of rats||rats}, provided that the sun isn't up. While outdoors, the vampire can call {@dice 3d6} {@creature wolf||wolves} instead. The called creatures arrive in {@dice 1d4} rounds, acting as allies of the vampire and obeying its spoken commands. The beasts remain for 1 hour, until the vampire dies, or until the vampire dismisses them as a bonus action.
{@homebrew At the DM's discretion, Mei Ling can alternatively summon swarms of {@creature swarm of quippers||quippers}, or call upon {@creature reef shark||reef sharks} instead of wolves.}

legendary.name: Move
entries: The vampire moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: The vampire makes one unarmed strike.

legendary.name: Bite (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The vampire makes one bite attack.

monster.name: Rugrig Foamtankard

immune.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

languages: Common, Dwarvish (can't speak in boar form)

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The wereboar can use its action to polymorph into a boar-humanoid hybrid or into a boar, or back into its true form, which is humanoid. Its statistics, other than its AC, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Charge (Boar or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: If the wereboar moves at least 15 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with its tusks on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Relentless (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If the wereboar takes 14 damage or less that would reduce it to 0 hit points, it is reduced to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Dwarven Resilience
entries: Rugrig has advantage on saving throws against poison.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Rugrig trägt eine {@item periapt of wound closure}.

action.name: Multiattack (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: The wereboar makes two attacks, only one of which can be with its tusks.

action.name: Spiked Gauntlets (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage. If Rugrig attacks with the gauntlets, he can make an additional gauntlet attack as a bonus action.

action.name: Tusks (Boar or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be cursed with wereboar lycanthropy.

entries: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d6 + 10}) slashing damage.

entries: Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Fire Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragon exhales fire in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 24} Dexterity saving throw, taking 91 ({@damage 26d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
